Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Prepare documentation for embedded readme feature" (#8426) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
- [ ] Update error docs and nuspec/MSBuild reference - already finished by Advay https://github.com/NuGet/docs.microsoft.com-nuget/pull/2118#issuecomment-781447122
- [ ] Update best practices doc to include readme suggestion
- [ ] Add allowlist and general information about new Readme/documentation feature to https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/nuget-org/publish-a-package

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[SAS Token] Create get only uri methods for files." (#8424) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Added new methods to retrieve the file/package uri. This will help us support sas tokens that are not generated on methods that returns an uri with the sas token embeded.

Since we are tightening validation for images in markdown, we can remove the 'ImagesRewritten' functionality after the allow list is stabilized.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "dotnet restore only tries one source" (#6140) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @keslerm on March 6, 2017 19:14_

> Œª  dotnet --version
> 1.0.0-rc4-004771

When using dotnet restore with either a nuget.config with multiple sources, or passing multiple -s options it only tries one source. 

This means that when trying to do dotnet restore on a project that has a private repo and a public repo and pulls from both, the restore operation will fail because obviously some package disparity between the two repos will exist.

Results from running:
    Œª  dotnet restore                                                                                                                                                                                                        
      Restoring packages for C:\Project\example.csproj...                                                                                                                                      
      Retrying 'FindPackagesByIdAsyncCore' for source 'https://privaterepo.com/FindPackagesById()?id='YamlDotNet.Signed''.                                                                     
      Response status code does not indicate success: 404 (Not Found).                                                                                                                                                       
      Retrying 'FindPackagesByIdAsyncCore' for source 'https://privaterepo.com/FindPackagesById()?id='WebSocketSharp''.                                                                        
      Response status code does not indicate success: 404 (Not Found).                                                                                                                                                       
      Retrying 'FindPackagesByIdAsyncCore' for source 'https://privaterepo.com/FindPackagesById()?id='EntityFramework.CodeFirstStoreFunctions''.                                               `

_Copied from original issue: Microsoft/dotnet#361_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Signing: implement dotnet sign command" (#8052) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Implement "dotnet sign" command according to NuGet.exe command "nuget sign".

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Improve error message when package is rejected by trusted signers configuration" (#10587) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Please read the following information before posting the issue. -->
<!-- If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), you are in the right place. -->
<!-- If you're having trouble with the NuGet.org Website, please post in [NuGetGallery issues](http://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues) -->

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: nuget.exe

Product version: v5.8.1

NuGet ignores packages that do not meet my trusted signers configuration. However, the error message for this scenario is unclear and unhelpful.

## Repro steps and/or sample project

`packages.config` file:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<packages>
  <package id="Newtonsoft.Json" version="12.0.1" targetFramework="net472" />
</packages>
```

`nuget.config` file:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <trustedSigners>
    <repository name="nuget.org" serviceIndex="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json">
      <certificate fingerprint="0E5F38F57DC1BCC806D8494F4F90FBCEDD988B46760709CBEEC6F4219AA6157D" hashAlgorithm="SHA256" allowUntrustedRoot="false" />
      <owners>jamesnk</owners>
    </repository>
  </trustedSigners>
</configuration>
```

Now run a restore. Notice my restore source is the DEV environment, but my trusted signers is for PROD environment:

```ps1
.\nuget581.exe restore .\Project\Project.csproj -Source https://apidev.nugettest.org/v3/index.json -PackagesDirectory packages
```

The output:

```
...
Restoring NuGet package Newtonsoft.Json.12.0.1.
  GET https://apidev.nugettest.org/v3/flatcontainer/newtonsoft.json/12.0.1/newtonsoft.json.12.0.1.nupkg
  OK https://apidev.nugettest.org/v3/flatcontainer/newtonsoft.json/12.0.1/newtonsoft.json.12.0.1.nupkg 166ms
Installing Newtonsoft.Json 12.0.1.
WARNING: Unable to find version '12.0.1' of package 'Newtonsoft.Json'.
  C:\Users\sharm\.nuget\packages\: Package 'Newtonsoft.Json.12.0.1' is not found on source 'C:\Users\sharm\.nuget\packages\'.
  https://apidev.nugettest.org/v3/index.json:

WARNING: Unable to find version '12.0.1' of package 'Newtonsoft.Json'.
  C:\Users\sharm\.nuget\packages\: Package 'Newtonsoft.Json.12.0.1' is not found on source 'C:\Users\sharm\.nuget\packages\'.
  https://apidev.nugettest.org/v3/index.json:


Errors in packages.config projects
    Unable to find version '12.0.1' of package 'Newtonsoft.Json'.
      C:\Users\sharm\.nuget\packages\: Package 'Newtonsoft.Json.12.0.1' is not found on source 'C:\Users\sharm\.nuget\packages\'.
      https://apidev.nugettest.org/v3/index.json:

...
```

Ideally the error message should explain the package wasn't installed due to trusted signers policy:

> NU1234: Package Newtonsoft.Json 12.0.1 could not be installed as it does not meet your trusted signers configuration.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Nuget restore is failed in Windows build." (#10586) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
---
**Issue moved from dotnet/core#5881**
- Please respond to @vsafonkin.

---

_From @vsafonkin on Tuesday, January 26, 2021 2:38:36 PM_

<!--This is just a template - feel free to delete any and all of it and replace as appropriate. If you're not sure of an answer, just skip it. We'll help you! -->

### Description

* Sometimes `dotnet build` command is failed on Nuget restore step. The error:
```
error NU1101: Unable to find package <package name>. No packages exist with this id in source(s): Microsoft Visual Studio Offline Packages
```
* repro: https://github.com/vsafonkin/ualbion/runs/1726489951?check_suite_focus=true

### Configuration

* Which version of .NET is the code running on? 5.0.101
* What OS and version, and for Linux, what distro? Windows
* What is the architecture (x64, x86, ARM, ARM64)? x64

It can be fixed either with creation `nuget.config` file with nuget sources list or running `dotnet nuget locals all --clear` before build.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Verify command is not disabled on Mono" (#10585) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We haven't supported package verification/signing on Mono.
But for now, when running mono command to verify packages, it will attempt to verify and finally fail.
This is confusing so we should disable the verify command on Mono and just show message like  "not supported".

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Remove unreachable code EventTrigger.dll" (#10584) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: NuGet 2.xx

## Repro steps and/or sample project

I found dead code "EventTrigger.dll" from NuGet 2.xx era
It was introduced [here](https://github.com/anurse/NuGet/commit/9d172f2db54ea6efb807e56693e4bbeaf53942e0).
Now it's time to remove it.
![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5eb1d84a3cd56675c3efe510/a9c1f3b8-e745-400b-bb17-3631324515b3)

Do you know ECCN classification for:
‚Ä¢	NetEsxapades.configuration.Yaml: Read configurations files in yaml or yml format. C# dotnet core does not have a buoild in reader for this type of config files. Our standard config files are in yaml format.
‚Ä¢	NEST: Connect to a elasticsearch database. We are using these kind of database to store or logging

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet restore failing on .NET 5 for Debian-based OSes" (#49) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Hey Everyone,

Our preliminary investigation shows that .NET 5 restore is broken for Debian-based operating systems including Docker thus resulting in error messages like:

```
error NU3037: Package 'System.Memory 4.5.3' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature validity period has expired.
```

### [Debian Versions](https://www.debian.org/releases/)
- We're currently aware that Debian 10 ("buster") and earlier versions are affected. ‚ùå
- We do know that Debian testing ("bullseye") and later are not affected. ‚úî

This is because of an [issue reported](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=962596) in the `ca-certificates` package in which the root CA being used are not trusted and must be installed manually due to [Symantec Issues](https://wiki.mozilla.org/CA:Symantec_Issues). Because this issue has been resolved recently in version 20210119 of this package, it is not available in a Debian version as provided in `dotnet-docker` for `buster-slim` today.

## Workarounds

- Manually update the [ca-certificates](https://packages.debian.org/bullseye/ca-certificates) package to version 20210119 including a `bullseye` or later version.
- Consider using a different Debian-based Docker image such as `alpine` or `focal`.
 
## Solution

We're currently working to update the `dotnet-docker`'s `buster-slim` image to update the `ca-certificates` package to 20210119 that resolves this issue. We are however currently verifying this is a viable solution with no large diffs between the `buster` and `bullseye` releases.

Additionally, the `ca-certificates` package is due to be installed in the Debian FTP archive which will promote this fix to the `buster` release in the next few days to which an updated `buster-slim` image will be prepared and released when available.

## Stay Updated

- We are continuing to investigate this issue and will let you know more as we find out.
- We'll continue to update the discussion at https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10491.
- We will also continue posting updates on https://status.nuget.org and on Twitter @NuGet.
